abstract: While Spyker Cars, the Dutch luxury carmaker, is trying to get General Motors to look at its revised bid for Saab, despite G.M.’s announcement that it would wind down its Swedish business, Swedish leaders have accepted the parent company’s decision, and are trying to live with a death foretold.
snippet: While Spyker Cars, the Dutch luxury carmaker, is trying to get General Motors to look at its revised bid for Saab, despite G.M.’s announcement that it would wind down its Swedish business, Swedish leaders have accepted the parent company’s decisio...
lead_paragraph: While Spyker Cars, the Dutch luxury carmaker, is trying to get General Motors to look at its revised bid for Saab, despite the American company’s announcement that it would wind down its Swedish business, Swedish leaders have accepted the parent company’s decision, and are trying to live with a death foretold.

headline.main: In Sweden, Living With a Death Foretold
